titleInfo.title: Diagram of the Second Provisional Regiment area at Camp Forrest

mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. mods.abstract: Diagram of the area at Camp Forrest detailing the location of the different posts for the Second Provisional Regiment of the Tennessee State Guard during their maneuvers to be held March 25 to April 1, 1944.

Camp Forrest operated as a major World War II training camp, hospital center, and maneuvers base from 1941 to 1946. Having been constructed east of Tullahoma and near the site of the old Camp Peay National Guard Camp, it occupied 85,000 acres, and eventually became a prisoner of war camp as well.
